text:
Story battles of which this music is heard:
1. The first battle outside Orbonne Monastery
2. Algus/Argath's betrayal during the battle at Fort Zeakden
3. Battle at Goug Slums
4. Delita and Ovelia Vs Two Ninjas (WOTL only)
5. Zalmo's last battle in Zeltennia
6. Battle against Rofel at the 2nd floor underground storage of Orbonne Monastery.

text:
I always get amused by how this huge, climatic sounding music plays for a tutorial fight against a bunch of easily dispatched nobodies.  You'd think this was the last fight in the game or some shit.

But in all seriousness, this game was an instant classic.  You knew when you heard this playing for the first fight in the game you were in for something special.

text:
I've only watched my cousins play the first mission of this game, and the music stuck in my head, every time I emulated a Tactics Ogre game, this song played in my head. Any time I imagined a Tactics Ogre scenario or any game based thereof, this song played in my head.

Thanks to games like this and Far Cry 4, I think it might be rule of thumb that the mission of defending a monastery might have some kickass OST. (Look up "Cultural Exchange Far Cry 4", and find a silent walkthrough. You'll see what I mean)

author: Daniel Mears

text: I love how well they blended together the music of XII and Tactics given they take place in the same world. Does anyone know if the same composer of tactics also compose the music of XII?
author: Zipherys

text:
The composers for both game are indeed the same person. Hitoshi Sakimoto (I know that he did Tactics but I don't think that he was alone on XII).

I love his sound as well. :3

I have not heard all of his music but I want to share 2 pieces of his music that I really love. Check out Attic of the Great Cathedral from Vagrant Story and  "A Fate Accepted" from Odin Sphere (again I don't think it's him alone but he had his hand in it).

I hope you enjoy and keep on listening.
author: Talthain

text: if you liked the OSTs for tactics and XII, then you should also check out the ones for tactics advance and tactics advance 2. also many reused tracks and an overall very similiar style since its also done by hitoshi sakimoto. also i can recommend the valkyria chronicles soundtrack (not a final fantasy game but OST is also by hitoshi sakimoto and reminds me alot of the tactics games !)

author: Sin Midani

text:
If anyone wants a true challenge, go find the Final Fantasy Tactics 1.3 mod. Rebalanced things, altered some skills especially Black Magic, and made the AI god mode. You must truly outplay them and have strategy to win. 

Have to pay attention to CT and speeds of characters to prevent enemies revive chaining, weighing your odds of success Curse Striking enemies for Oil+Poison with archers so you can use explosion/comet to delete them, etc.

Anyone who truly gets into the FFT gameplay should love this mod. It really stretches your skills and planning to win fights.

author: DestinLe

text:
This game, even today, is the definition of Cutting the Edge.

Phenominal Music, even by today's standards.
Plotline is fantastic, and even disturbing.  Banned in some places for it's religious overtones, and various "realities".
Gameplay was entertaining, and you get to use control the most over powered character ever designed.  T.G.Cid makes the game to easy.  :p

The characters are fantastic, the story is equally so.  The music is a bonus, and could have made the game on it's own.

text: @FanofniceGameMusic Agreed wholeheartedly. This game shaped me as a person. I literally grew up with this game, and I don't think I'll ever outlive the impact it has had on me. author: fonarte

text: Some people complained about the sound quality of the music. And it's simple really, The original was Sequenced sound played through the Playstation using Effects like Reverb. The sound is essentially the same minus the Reverb. This is what the sound samples sounded like RAW. And they did this for an obvious reason. With all the reverb listening through just the psp speaker you wouldn't be able to hear all the instruments clearly. They didn't do it with Full Stereo in mind
author: fonarte

author: UmbreonMessiah

text:
Yeah, this music made slaughtering him really epic! I had Delita deliver the last blow on him and I laughed hysterically when Algus passed out. It still was quite a shock to see him betray Ramza and killing Teta. But that's what made the plot so great. Twists. 

Gosh, it must be about 10 years since I first played this. I'm one of the few in Finland that have played the original Tactics. My Playstation was modded to support American releases and FFT became one of my treasures. I'm so lucky! :)
